content.description: Slab moves bring you to a boulder problem roof pull through a slot.  Much easier climbing leads to the chains.
content.location: On the "Brynozone" left of the main Rhinozone wall.  Second route from the left, following through the slot.

content.description: Start on easier terrain and then traverse left under a roof, head straight up, and stay left as you pull over the final roof.
content.location: Center of the Rhinozone wall, just left of Rhinovirus

content.description: Start with a boulder move up onto a slab, then pull through a series of steeper sections on good holds.
content.location: Right end of the main Rhinozone area with the unmistakeable roof on top.

content.description: Climb on a prow between cracks past a series of bolts onto a ledge.  Pull steep moves up and right on big holds to another small roof.  At this point Safari So Good stays on the arete to the left and Rhinoplasty finishes up and right through the scoop.
content.location: On the prow between Safari So Good and Crazy Mzungu

content.description: A fun arete.  The crack to the left goes at around 5.8 with fiddly pro.
content.protection:
7 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor.  A green camalot can be used in the horizontal crack between the 6th and 7th bolts.

Extended Conversion

, 5.10b, above requires 4 more draws.
content.location: On the arete, just left of the chimney/gully separating Rhinozone into two walls (Rhinozone and Brynozone).  Rap off of chains.

content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.  Rap off of chains.
content.location:
The bolted face to the left of the left-most crack (

Jam-o-Rama

, 5.8) through the roof on the left side of Rhinozone (Brynozone).

content.description: A nice hand crack through a roof.  Footholds and jugs abound.  Protects well.  Short but enjoyable.
content.protection: Single rack to 3".  2-bolt anchor with chains.  There are bolts on the face below the roof, but they are entirely unnecessary (there are ample cracks there).
content.location: The right-most crack through the roof at the left end of Rhinozone (Brynozone).

content.description: Begin on Missionary's Exposition, continuing up the gap above the anchor (with a long draw on it), stemming for a few moves before stepping onto the upper right face and finishing a few bolts later at the anchor.
~.10b boulder off the ground leads to .9 climbing to an exciting .11- boulder at the top. Another beautiful bulge challenge at the rhino.
content.location: Straight up line just right of the bolted crack. Second line from the right on the main section of the rhino. Weaves left around a couple prominent blocks/roofs and up right at the top to some recessed anchors up the slab ~12 feet.

content.description: Steep climb out of a cave. Depending on your height a number of approaches may be used.
content.protection: Generously bolted (4 bolts) with bolted anchors.
content.location: The obvious cave uphill to the right of the main Rhinozone area.

content.description: Climb the chimney featuring juggy flakes.  Great stemming practice.  Long run out to the anchor, which it shares with Missionary's Exposition.
Climbs jugs up and to the right, and then an absolutely beautiful handrail takes you back left, and then up and to the anchors.  Short but sweet.
content.location: This is the farthest right route in Zoner Cave of Rhinozone.  50 yards south of the parking lot.

content.description: At the overlap, stay right at first, then traverse left past the crux and up to the anchor.
content.location: To the right of Goof-Proof Roof.  They share the same anchor.
